member.name: T:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.ApiException
member.summary: Any error that is in the client side of this system. This includes unexpected return codes on a call.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.ApiException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The unexpected HTTP status code returned on a call.

member.value: The exception type.

member.name: T:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient
member.summary:
All calls to the Windward RESTful Engine are made by this object. All calls are async. In addition all operations performed by the RESTful engine are async too so for most calls you will make a call to submit a job, then make call(s) to get the status of the job, then a call to get the results of the job, and finally a call to delete the job.
On an error at the server end, the error will be returned by this client's call throwing an exception.
Create a singleton on this object and reuse it. Do not put it in a using(...) or create/dispose of it regularly. This wraps an HttpClient and while HttpClient is disposable (and therefore this class is), you will burn up connections and other resources with that approach. This object can be used concurrently and is thread safe.
This class uses log4net, but does not initialize it. It assumes you have initialized it in the manner you prefer.

member.name: F:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.HEADER_LICENSE
member.summary: Key to license setting in the header.

member.name: F:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.client
member.summary: The HttpClient this object will use for all calls to the RESTful Engine.

member.name: F:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.ourClient
member.summary: true if we created the client object. false if passed in.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The base address of Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the Internet resource used when sending requests. The uri must end with a /.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
The HttpClient this object will use for all calls to the RESTful Engine. Set client.BaseAddress before passing this in. The BaseAddress uri must end with a /. We will not dispose the passed in client object when this object is disposed.
Set Accept and Content-Type to JSON.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.Dispose
member.summary:
Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
Create a singleton of this object, you should only be disposing it when your application exits. We will not dispose the HttpClient object when this object is disposed if it was passed to this object in the constructor.

member.name: P:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.LicenseKey
member.summary: Set the license key to use for request(s) made by this client. Set to null to use the REST engine's license.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetVersion
member.summary: Performs a GET to return the version of the RESTful server.
member.returns: The version of the RESTful server and its underlying engine.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.PostDocument(WindwardRestApi.src.Model.Template)
member.summary: Post an async request to generate a document. This method completes when the request has been accepted by the RESTful engine. The only valid values in the returned Document are the Guid and Tag.
member.param: The template to parse for the document.
member.returns: The Guid of this requested job.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetDocumentStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Get the status for this pending document job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns:
It will return one of: Created (201) the job is in process, Accepted (202), the job is pending, Found (302) the job is complete and can be read, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke, which includes an invalid request.
You can GET (read) the result if it returns a Found or InternalServerError. For the InternalServerError case the GET will throw an exception with the relevant error information.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Get this completed job. Will throw a ServerException if the job failed for some reason.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: The document from the submitted template.
member.exception: If an error occured in the RESTful engine generating this document, the error information will be in this exception.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.DeleteDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Delete this document job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: It will return one of: OK (200) the job is deleted, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.PostMetrics(WindwardRestApi.src.Model.Template)
member.summary: Post an async request to generate the metrics. This method completes when the request has been accepted by the RESTful engine. The only valid values in the returned Metrics are the Guid and Tag.
member.param: The template to parse for the metrics.
member.returns: The Guid of this requested job.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetMetricsStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Get the status for this pending metrics job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns:
It will return one of: Created (201) the job is in process, Accepted (202), the job is pending, Found (302) the job is complete and can be read, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke, which includes an invalid request.
You can GET (read) the result if it returns a Found or InternalServerError. For the InternalServerError case the GET will throw an exception with the relevant error information.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetMetrics(System.String)
member.summary: Get this completed job. Will throw a ServerException if the job failed for some reason.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: The metrics from the submitted template.
member.exception: If an error occured in the RESTful engine generating this metrics, the error information will be in this exception.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.DeleteMetrics(System.String)
member.summary: Delete this metrics job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: It will return one of: OK (200) the job is deleted, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.PostTagTree(WindwardRestApi.src.Model.Template)
member.summary: Post an async request to generate a tag tree. This method completes when the request has been accepted by the RESTful engine. The only valid values in the returned TagTree are the Guid and Tag.
member.param: The template to parse for the tag tree.
member.returns: The Guid of this requested job.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetTagTreeStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Get the status for this pending tagtree job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns:
It will return one of: Created (201) the job is in process, Accepted (202), the job is pending, Found (302) the job is complete and can be read, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke, which includes an invalid request.
You can GET (read) the result if it returns a Found or InternalServerError. For the InternalServerError case the GET will throw an exception with the relevant error information.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.GetTagTree(System.String)
member.summary: Get this completed job. Will throw a ServerException if the job failed for some reason.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: The tag tree from the submitted template.
member.exception: If an error occured in the RESTful engine generating this tagtree, the error information will be in this exception.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Api.WindwardClient.DeleteTagTree(System.String)
member.summary: Delete this tagtree job.
member.param: The job id.
member.returns: It will return one of: OK (200) the job is deleted, NotFound (404) this job does not exist, and InternalServerError (500) something broke.

member.name: P:WindwardRestApi.src.Model.VersionInfo.ApiVersion
member.summary: The API version. For major.minor.revision.build: A change in build is cosmetic, documentation, etc. A change in revision is either an addition or fixing something that was broken. A change in minor changes the API to a minor extent. And a change in major is a significant change to the API.
member.value: The Reporting Engine version

member.name: T:WindwardRestApi.src.Model.Xml_10DataSource
member.summary: An XML 1.0 (.Net runtime) datasource to apply to a template. This can include datasets built from this datasource. Used as part of a document generation request. We strongly recommend you use Xml_20DataSource instead.

member.name: M:WindwardRestApi.src.Model.Xml_10DataSource.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Use this when using connection strings to connect to the XML file.
member.param: The datasource name which maps to the datasource attribute in tags.
The connection string to the XML file.
The connection string to the XSD file. null if no schema.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Use this when passing up the XML file.

The XML file.
The XSD file. null if no schema.
